episodes.title: Buckshot: This Isn't The Old School Immigration
episodes.description:
Buck Sexton talks about the book "The Revenge of Geography" by Kaplin. Buck talks about how people think this is the same type of immigration that we had in the early years of our country...it's not. "We often pretend that this is similar to temporary waves of people coming into the country from predominately Europe...those are waves of immigration and there were stops and starts to this. And there were times where the country said 'ok, we've got enough for now. Thank you.' That's the true history of immigration."

As deportation has drastically decreased in the last years of Obama's Presidency, some would say he has had a change of heart. The President now is taking steps to change the so called "wet foot / dry foot" policy.

After all the progress between the United States and Cuba with Obama in office, the President is now saying Cuban migrants are no longer welcome. This coming with only one week left of his Presidency.

"Effective immediately Cuban nationals who attempt to enter the United Stated illegally, and do not qualify for humanitarian relief, will be subject to removal consistent with U.S. law enforcement priorities."

episodes.description:
Buck Sexton reflects on the way President Obama handled national discourse and policy debate.

"Somehow, under the Obama presidency, every disagreement in politics was turned into a referendum of the character of those on each side, and of course his side was always good." - Buck Sexton

"He was constantly, constantly creating false arguments and then demolishing them ... there's also something really condescending and embarrassing about the way that not just the media but the world treated President Obama." - Buck Sexton

episodes.title: Buckshot: Rise Of North Korea With Gordon Chang
episodes.description:
Mike Opelka, filling in for Buck Sexton, discusses the latest on North Korea with author and Forbes contributor Gordon G Chang. North Korea has started a new missile program working with weapons capable of reaching the United States and other nations. Plus, Gordon shares more on his prediction that China will collapse.

"This is a threat we know will mature within the first term of President Trump."

"I think the Chinese state is unstable. It has an economy that is growing maybe half the reported 6.7% rate. They've been creating debt five times faster than GDP. They have an incomplete leadership transition ... and they've got a military which is becoming much more influential in policy circles. None of this is taking China in the right directions and I believe the country is fragile." - Gordon Chang

The Buck Sexton Show, Weekdays 12–3pm ET on The Blaze Radio.

episodes.title: Buckshot: Beneath Pluto's Icy Heart with Professor Richard Binzel
episodes.description:
Buck talking with Professor Richard Binzel of MIT about the possibility of finding intelligent life in our solar system and beyond.

"I would be surprised if there is not some other life, perhaps in our solar system or in the universe. It's one of the great mysteries. Life seems to be very special, but at the same time we are made of the stuff that is the most common stuff in the universe, Hydrogen, Oxygen, Nitrogen and Carbon. The ingredients of life are everywhere and it's just a great question, are we unique or are we commonplace? I tend to think we're likely to find life elsewhere." Professor Binzel
